instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
no water damage, ppbus 12.3v
R7020 5v
F7000 0v no short
L6960 3.3v

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: not enter to DFU

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.

Do you get 3.3V at L6960 and L7690?

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.
get 3.3V at L6960 and L7690.

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
Did you exactly follow all the steps from DFU tutorial?

Check voltage and diode mode to ground at all LDO rails of both CD3215 chips.

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA 489
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO 463
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC 481 [B]0V[/B]
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD 452

PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA 490
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO 466
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC 481 [B]1.1V[/B]
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD 452
bed CD3215?

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: bad*

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: o.k i see that  PP1V1_UPC_XB/A_LDO_BMC get voltage from his port..

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
So, you get correct 1V1 LDO on both ports?

Any history available?
Did you check for liquid sign on the audio board?
Remove it and check its both sides and audio flex.

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
Yes in both sides, no history(said suddenly) no liquid sign, audio board look perfect...
what else can it be?

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
"Did you exactly follow all the steps from DFU tutorial?"
?

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: yes i am, I'm doing that every day

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
Looks like T2 internal problem.
You can try forcing SOC_FORCE_DFU to 1V8_AWAKE.

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: make a jumper between them?

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: Yes, run a tiny wire.

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message: not working:sneaky:

threads.title: 820-01521-02 5v 0.04a
threads.message:
Bad T2, or something wrong with USB communication.
I suspect T2, if no corrosion on USB-C area.
